channel.title: Vestibule :: Suggestions for "Multi-hundred-model apps with Rails and Netzke"
channel.description: A list of all suggestions made for "Multi-hundred-model apps with Rails and Netzke"

item.title: Suggestion from Ivan Ilves (@)
item.description: Netzke allowed me to develop a couple of important apps in matter of days. I like almost every aspect of this framework. Looking forward to meet author. And yes, agree with Ebin J, Netzke will benefit from better documentation. :)

item.title: Suggestion from Paul Schyska (@pschyska)
item.description: If that's whom I think (the author of Netzke), I have seen him back in 2010 on Rubyandrails Amsterdam and was very impressed with it. The guy is a great speaker and what he showed us just blew my mind. Looking forward to see him!

item.title: Suggestion from Ebin J (@)
item.description: I am using netzke for all my rails projects. If some fine tuned documentation is given netzke will reach heights.

item.title: Suggestion from Dmytro Koval'ov (@)
item.description: I've used Netzke to develop pretty complex application for banking sector, and really enjoyed cleanliness of the design. It allowed me to finish project in much shorter time than I anticipated.
